title: (x) "Thank You For Your Purchase" basic grotesque in Adobe Order Confirmation - Vonness {Stephen}
content:
This is probably the most basic ID, and I'm embarrassed to post it. But, what is it? I think it's too small for whatthefont.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Screenshot\_1.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20110530043412/http:/typophile.com/files/Screenshot_1.png) | 6.17 KB |
author: dnabbate

comments.content:
I think it's Akzidenz Grotesk.

- Lex

I'd be surprised to hear Adobe is using AG these days. I believe their contract with Berthold ended many years ago.

This is probably just an oddly rendered [Helvetica](http://web.archive.org/web/20110530043412/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&startrow=1&records=20&currpage=1&totalrecords=5&searchby=&searchID=&searchletter=&searchstr=helvetica&font_categories_checkbox=font_name_search&fontRendererText=Thank+you+for+your).
Perhaps this is the ghost of Macromedia? What typeface did they use? It's certainly more interesting than rubbish old Myriad.

Ahh, good point, Nigella. Font Bureau created a custom version of [Venus](http://web.archive.org/web/20110530043412/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=venus) for Macromedia called [Vonnes](http://web.archive.org/web/20110530043412/http:/web.archive.org/web/19990508164024/www.fontbureau.com/custom/). That link goes to an archive.org cache. Sadly, no images remain. But the exclusivity contract with Macromedia was supposed to expire in 2005. Write Font Bureau and ask.

Stephen, I believe you're right. I found a new 'Vonness' (with two Ss) at the Font Bureau under Newspaper fonts.

[http://www.fontbureau.com/newspaper/fonts/Vonness](http://web.archive.org/web/20110530043412/http:/www.fontbureau.com/newspaper/fonts/Vonness "http://www.fontbureau.com/newspaper/fonts/Vonness")

So, I believe that wraps this one up!
Yep. They just released it again.
